Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix under Apache License?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=Srvc5_rdEPu3g9gQ5p4cDsPvSm5TJDDmnf-giFeYBMBm
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Bjarne Andersen wrote:
> We are currently distributing heritrix together with NetarchiveSuite (http://netarchive.dk/suite) under the LGPL license.
> 
> Will it be a problem to bundle heritrix (under Apache License) with software under LGPL ??

I don't think so; the Apache License is very liberal about where code so 
licensed may be included.

The Apache License 2.0 is explicitly, by the interpretation of both the 
Apache Software Foundation and the Free Software Foundation, compatible 
with GPL 3.0. See:

http://www.apache.org/licenses/GPL-compatibility.html

I presume that this also includes the GPL3-derived LGPL 3.0.

As noted at that link, the ASF and FSF may disagree about certain 
combinations of earlier licenses, but in a work for which your 
organization is the rightsholder, I'm not even sure strict 
'compatibility' is required. Heritrix under either LGPL or Apache may be 
redistributed and integrated as part of larger packages, no matter what 
the enclosing package's licenses.

The only controversy in this area that I recall hearing about was when 
one GPL'd project removed the Apache license notice from certain code 
and placed a GPL-based license in its place. I doubt you're planning that.

If this were demonstrated to be a problem, we could consider 
dual-licensing under Apache and LGPL indefinitely. But, I'd rather avoid 
that complexity, if not absolutely necessary.

- Gordon @ IA
